thread.title: Tunisia: Draft Supplementary Finance Law 2015 - Factbox
thread.title_full: Tunisia: Draft Supplementary Finance Law 2015 - Factbox

title: Tunisia: Draft Supplementary Finance Law 2015 - Factbox
text:
Tunisia: Launch of Tenders for Sale of Seven Confiscated Companies and 14 Other Properties 
The Government seeks to contain the deficit in the State budget to around 4.8% of the gross domestic product (4,186 MTD) against the 4.9% of the GDP (4,391 MTD) provided for in the main budget so as to reduce public debts to 51.9% of the GDP against 52.9% as set out in the main budget. 
Resources of the 2015 complementary budget: 
The State's own resources stand at 21,152 MTD including 18, 510 MTD in fiscal resources and 2,642 MTD in non-tax revenues. Loan resources hover around 6,748 MTD. 
Expenditure of the complementary budget: 
Management expenses: these expenses stand at 17,702 MTD against the 17,970 MTD planned in the main budget which will help reduce net expenses by 268 MTD. 
The expenditure of the supplementary budget is shared out as follows: 
11,631 MTD for wages 
1,815 MTD to finance other operations. 
Development expenditure: 5,264 MTD against the budgeted 5,800 MTD. Tunisia
